snippet: As tens of thousands protested the Beijing-backed “moral and national education” plan as brainwashing and political indoctrination, Hong Kong’s chief executive revoked a 2015 deadline for the project.
abstract: Hong Kong’s chief executive, Leung Chun-ying, faced with tens of thousands of protesters contending that a Beijing-backed plan for moral and national education amounts to brainwashing and political indoctrination, backpedals and revokes a 2015 deadline for every school to start teaching it; many protesters are not mollified, demanding that the education plan be withdrawn entirely.
lead_paragraph: As tens of thousands protested the Beijing-backed “moral and national education” plan as brainwashing and political indoctrination, Hong Kong’s chief executive revoked a 2015 deadline for the project.

headline.seo: Amid Protest, Hong Kong Retreats on ‘Moral Education’ Plan
headline.main: Hong Kong Retreats on ‘National Education’ Plan
headline.print_headline: Hong Kong Retreats on ‘National Education’ Plan
